name: Staatsgalerie Stuttgart
excerpt: The neoclassical-meets-contemporary Staatsgalerie bears British architect James Stirling’s curvy, colourful imprint. Alongside big-name exhibitions, the…
detail_description:
The neoclassical-meets-contemporary Staatsgalerie bears British architect James Stirling’s curvy, colourful imprint. Alongside big-name exhibitions, the gallery harbours a stellar collection of European art from the 14th to the 21st centuries, and American post-WWII avant-gardists. Highlights include works by Miró, Picasso, Matisse, Kandinsky and Klee. Special billing goes to masterpieces such as Dalí's The Sublime Moment (1938), Rembrandt's pensive, chiaroscuro Saint Paul in Prison (1627), Max Beckmann's utterly compelling, large-scale Resurrection (1916) and Monet's diffuse Fields in the Spring (1887).
Recent temporary exhibitions have homed in on everything from pop art to Catholic splendour during the Reformation.

name: Karlsplatz
excerpt: A bronze equestrian statue of German Emperor Wilhelm I (r 1871-1888) stands proud on Karlsplatz.
detail_description: A bronze equestrian statue of German Emperor Wilhelm I (r 1871-1888) stands proud on Karlsplatz.

name: Stiftskirche
excerpt: Topped by two mismatched towers, this largely 15th-century church has Romanesque origins.
detail_description: Topped by two mismatched towers, this largely 15th-century church has Romanesque origins.

name: Friedrich Schiller Statue
excerpt: The poet-dramatist Friedrich Schiller is immortalised in bronze on cobbled Schillerplatz.
detail_description: The poet-dramatist Friedrich Schiller is immortalised in bronze on cobbled Schillerplatz.

name: Mittlerer Schlossgarten
excerpt: The fountain-dotted Mittlerer Schlossgarten draws thirsty crowds to its beer garden in summer.
detail_description: The fountain-dotted Mittlerer Schlossgarten draws thirsty crowds to its beer garden in summer.

name: Schillerplatz
excerpt: Cobbled Schillerplatz is where the poet-dramatist Friedrich Schiller is immortalised in bronze.
detail_description: Cobbled Schillerplatz is where the poet-dramatist Friedrich Schiller is immortalised in bronze.

name: Württembergischer Kunstverein
excerpt: Identified by its copper cupola, this gallery stages thought-provoking contemporary art exhibitions. There are free guided tours (in German) at 3pm on…
detail_description: Identified by its copper cupola, this gallery stages thought-provoking contemporary art exhibitions. There are free guided tours (in German) at 3pm on Sundays.

name: Unterer Schlossgarten
excerpt: The Unterer Schlossgarten is a ribbon of greenery rambling northeast to the Neckar River and the Rosensteinpark, home to the zoo.
detail_description: The Unterer Schlossgarten is a ribbon of greenery rambling northeast to the Neckar River and the Rosensteinpark, home to the zoo.

name: Landtag
excerpt: One of Oberer Schlossgarten's most eye-catching landmarks is the ultra-modern Landtag, a glass rectangle housing the state parliament.
detail_description: One of Oberer Schlossgarten's most eye-catching landmarks is the ultra-modern Landtag, a glass rectangle housing the state parliament.

name: Kriegsberg Vineyards
excerpt: The Kriegsberg vineyards rise up just north of the Hauptbahnhof. It's a fine place for a blow-away-the-cobwebs stroll, especially when autumn paints the…
detail_description: The Kriegsberg vineyards rise up just north of the Hauptbahnhof. It's a fine place for a blow-away-the-cobwebs stroll, especially when autumn paints the vines gold.

name: Oberer Schlossgarten
excerpt: The Oberer Schlossgarten is framed by eye-catching landmarks such as the columned Staatstheater and the ultra-modern, glass-clad Landtag.
detail_description: The Oberer Schlossgarten is framed by eye-catching landmarks such as the columned Staatstheater and the ultra-modern, glass-clad Landtag.

name: Neues Schloss
excerpt: Standing proud on stately Schlossplatz, the three-winged Neues Schloss is Duke Karl Eugen von Württemberg’s answer to Versailles. The baroque-neoclassical…
detail_description: Standing proud on stately Schlossplatz, the three-winged Neues Schloss is Duke Karl Eugen von Württemberg’s answer to Versailles. The baroque-neoclassical royal residence now houses state government ministries.

name: Turmforum
excerpt: Some of the best views of Stuttgart are from the the top of the tower jutting out from the main train station. A free lift (elevator) deposits you right…
detail_description: Some of the best views of Stuttgart are from the the top of the tower jutting out from the main train station. A free lift (elevator) deposits you right below the revolving Mercedes star. You also get a bird’s-eye view of 'Stuttgart 21', a huge – and controversial – revamp of the main train station. Exhibits on floors 3, 5 and 7a explain the details.

name: Wilhelma Zoologisch-Botanischer Garten
excerpt: Wilhelma Zoologisch-Botanischer Garten is a quirky mix of zoo and botanical gardens. Kid magnets include semistriped okapis, elephants, penguins and a…
detail_description: Wilhelma Zoologisch-Botanischer Garten is a quirky mix of zoo and botanical gardens. Kid magnets include semistriped okapis, elephants, penguins and a petting farm. Greenhouses sheltering tree ferns, camellias and Amazonian species are among the botanical highlights. Sniff out the gigantic bloom of the malodorous titan arum in the Moorish Villa.

name: Kunstmuseum Stuttgart
excerpt: Occupying a shimmering glass cube, this gallery presents high-calibre special exhibits alongside a permanent gallery filled with a prized collection of…

name: Landesmuseum Württemberg
excerpt: An archway leads to the turreted 10th-century Altes Schloss, where this museum features regional archaeology and architecture. The historic booty includes…
detail_description: An archway leads to the turreted 10th-century Altes Schloss, where this museum features regional archaeology and architecture. The historic booty includes Celtic jewellery, neolithic pottery, diamond-encrusted crown jewels and rare artefacts. Time your visit to see, from the arcaded courtyard, the rams above the clock tower lock horns on the hour. Entry to the permanent collection is free.

name: Planetarium Stuttgart
excerpt: This pyramid-shaped planetarium uses up-to-the-minute technology to virtually propel you into outer space, with highly realistic projections of…
detail_description: This pyramid-shaped planetarium uses up-to-the-minute technology to virtually propel you into outer space, with highly realistic projections of constellations and planets, plus plenty of background on astronomy. There are a number of different shows, many with fancy laser and music displays. Show times vary; check the website for latest listings. English audioguides are available.

name: Fernsehturm

excerpt: When temperatures soar, Stuttgarters head to Max-Eyth-See for pedalo fun on the lake and picnicking beside the Neckar River. Murky water rules out…
